message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Misoprostol is a prostaglandin E1 analog that is used to prevent gastric ulcers. However, it is contraindicated during pregnancy because of its ability to stimulate uterine contractions and may cause abortion. Magnesium hydroxide is an antacid that is considered safe during pregnancy. Cimetidine and sucralfate are also safe to use during pregnancy for heartburn and gastric ulcer treatment, respectively.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only Misoprostol can cause harm to the fetus and should be avoided during pregnancy. Magnesium hydroxide, Cimetidine, and Sucralfate are safe to use during pregnancy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Misoprostol is a prostaglandin analog that can cause uterine contractions and is contraindicated in pregnancy. Magnesium hydroxide, cimetidine, and sucralfate are safe to use for the relief of symptoms in pregnant women.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Misoprostol is contraindicated in pregnancy as it can cause abortion or birth defects. The patient is 16 weeks pregnant, so misoprostol should be avoided. Magnesium hydroxide, cimetidine, and sucralfate are all considered safe during pregnancy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is pregnant and has epigastric discomfort, which can be caused by gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD). Misoprostol is a prostaglandin analogue that can cause miscarriage and should be avoided in pregnancy. Magnesium hydroxide, cimetidine, and sucralfate are safe to use in pregnancy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Misoprostol is contraindicated during pregnancy because it can cause abortion or congenital abnormalities. Magnesium hydroxide, cimetidine, and sucralfate are all commonly used for the treatment of gastrointestinal symptoms during pregnancy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is pregnant and Misoprostol is contraindicated in pregnant women because it can cause uterine contractions and potential harm to the fetus. Magnesium hydroxide, Cimetidine, and Sucralfate are all safe for use in pregnancy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Misoprostol is a medication used to induce labor and should be avoided during pregnancy. Magnesium hydroxide, cimetidine, and sucralfate are all safe to use during pregnancy for treatment of acid reflux and ulcers.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is pregnant, and Misoprostol is contraindicated for use during pregnancy because it can cause uterine contractions and potentially harm the fetus. The other options are safe to use during pregnancy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Misoprostol is a category X medication and it is contraindicated in pregnancy as it can cause uterine contractions and lead to miscarriage, premature birth, or fetal death. Magnesium hydroxide, cimetidine, and sucralfate are category B medications and can be used with caution during pregnancy.
